Comment: What general strike?¬†   I don't understand why Reddit has this fetish with general strikes.   America has no tradition of effective general strikes. The countries that do, have strong labor unions because it's the labor unions that not only organize the general strikes but they also provide the strike fund so that people who live hand to mouth can afford to stay out of work for a week or more. None of those conditions exist here.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†   Without strong labor union membership, strong labor union leaders and a culture of general strikes you're not going to get them.¬†¬† Expecting a general strike in the United States is like expecting a ski industry in Florida - the conditions don't exist.
